ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This interdisciplinary video course provides wide ranging source materials and references. We acquired necessary technical skills (shooting, editing, building etc. with pro-grade equipment and software) while learning about the history of video and its contemporary evolution.
Video making/editing, an understanding of the various kinds of peep shows / persistence of vision, new ways of approaching these mediums

-using Adobe premiere
-using digital video camera
-accessing various university technology resources
-some historical context on early cinema, video art, comedy

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This has been one of my favorite courses at Yale. The assignments were well thought out and conducive to our technical and conceptual development over the semester. It was great working with my classmates and drawing inspiration from their work. One of my favorite moments in the course was a field trip to NY to see an installation we did on a Times Square billboard.
Loved the projects, critiques, field trips. Wish there could've been more time for class conversations

-needs to move faster, much more material could be covered in the time allotted
-each class period needs to be much better planned, we wasted so much time sitting around
-it's really hard to sit in the dark for four hours--please turn the lights on! we don't always need lights off when we're just looking at a powerpoint of slides. this is unbelievably distracting and such a simple way to increase energy and engagement

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course.
Yes! I loved the format / assignments of this couse!
Yes, but it is disorganized and think there overall could have been more material covered/higher expectations of students
